text: Hupan University (湖畔大学) is a corporate business school located in Hangzhou, Zhejiang Province, China. It was founded in 2015 by Jack Ma, founder of Alibaba Group, a multinational technology conglomerate. == History == Jack Ma and nine fellow business executives decided to found a school based in China, during the 2015–16 Chinese stock market turbulence as China's answer to Harvard Business School, which itself was founded during the banking panic of 1907.Private companies have put down strong roots in China. The Economist. London. 30 April 2020 The institution also offers online classes. == Alumni == * Justin Sun == References == == External links == * Category:Education in Hangzhou Category:Business schools in China Category:2015 establishments in China
title: Hupan University
